creator: egalsim@slk.com
text:
I've installed FopServlet in a TomCat Server. And when I run the servlet 
with fo paramter (example, FopServlet?fo=giro.fo), I get the pdf. However,
when I run it with xsl and xml parms (FopServlet?xsl=m1.xsl&xml=m1.xml), 
I get a blank screen with a black border.

I need a way to transform my xml to pdf in real time. like when a user clicks
on the button, i'd give him pdf.

Has anybody used the servlet with these parms? I'm using acrobat 5.0 and 
i.e. 6.0. Or would you advice me to just use Cocoon?

tia,
emmanuel

creator: keiron@aftexsw.com
text:
This could be due to a number of problems (IE, invalid xml etc.) but the 
servlet does work.

I had the same problem.

I tihnk, the problem is in your Web Browser.
My solution is to save PDF file in Temporary directory
and then redirect client to that PDF file.

Than IE6 opens PDF file correctly.
creator: big_eugene@mail.ru
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
